FacilityName: Gulf Liquids New River Project-Sorrento Gas Plant
ParentCompanyName: Gulf Liquids New River Project LLC

_prev_prog_3.Description:
The Sorrento facility is intended to treat an off-gas stream from a Fluidized Bed Catalytic Cracking operation of the nearby refinery and capture as much as possible of the hydrocarbon components higher in molecular weight than methane and return the methane to the refinery, where the returned gas is used in various direct fired heaters in the refinery.  Trace contaminants like dusts, chlorides, water and sulfurous materials originally in the incoming gas are removed to improve the quality of the facility?s products.  Equipment used to remove trace contaminants includes a dehydration system, arsine catalyst bed and chloride trap.

The process raises the pressure of the gas stream using fixed speed reciprocating compressors and lowers the temperature using multistage heat exchangers and an auxiliary refrigeration process (or closed loop) so that liquid hydrocarbons are formed.  These can be purified using standard unit operations like distillation, absorption, stripping, etc. ? operations that are common to petrochemical operations and have a good safety record.

The equipment is designed to contain high pressure flammable liquids that have a low boiling point at atmospheric pressure and are vapors under standard ambient conditions.

The primary process hazards are flash fires and potential vapor cloud explosions if large quantities of process materials are inadvertently released to the atmosphere and find a source of ignition.  Additional hazards are created by the refrigeration system and the cold temperatures that are created that can lead to ice formation internally and externally.  The process materials can generate near-cryogenic temperatures under certain conditions.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the facility: This facility complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws.  If an emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Sorrento Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  Additional emergency response can be obtained through the St. Amant Fire Department, if necessary.

A description of the facility and the regulated substances handled: This facility is a cryogenic plant that receives refinery off gas from the adjacent Convent Refinery.  The refinery off gas is liquefied in the cryogenic unit.  The design rate for off gas processing is 32 MMSCF/day.  This liquefied gas will be transmitted offsite via pipeline.  Methane and hydrogen gas components of the off gas are returned to the refinery. 

The worst-case release scenario and alternative release scenario.

The worst-case scenario is a release of a flammable hydrocarbon mixture from the total failure of a 5,000-gallon surge tank.   The worst-case scenario assumes that the entire quantity of a 5,000-gallon tank (18,354 lbs) is completely released. According to results using EPA's Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidance Reference Tables or Equations, the distance to the overpressure endpoint for this quantity of a flammable mixture is 0.24 miles.  Distance to the endpoint was calculated using methods described in Section 5.2 of the EPA?s RMP Guidance for Offsite Consequence Analysis.  This distance to the endpoint for the mixture was used as the endpoint for all individual flammable components.  The facility is located in a rural area and would affect facility personnel and an unknown number of personnel and at an adjacent industrial facility.

The alternative release scenario is based on the rupture of the piping that feeds the surge tank.  It is estimated that approximately 1,207 pounds of the mixture would be released before facility personnel could discover the leak and block off the pipeline

(2 minutes). According to results using EPA's Offsite Consequence Analysis Guidance Reference Tables or Equations, the distance to the overpressure endpoint for this quantity of a flammable mixture is 0.06 miles. Distance to the endpoint was calculated using methods described in Section 5.2 of the EPA?s RMP Guidance for Offsite Consequence Analysis.  A yield factor of 3 percent was used in the calculation of the alternative scenario.  This distance to the endpoint for the mixture was used as the endpoint for all individual flammable components.  The alternative scenario release of this mixture would affect facility personnel and an unknown number of personnel and at an adjacent industrial facility.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps.  This facility complies with EPA?s accident prevention rule, OSHA?s PSM rule, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations.  

Five-year accident history.  Gulf Liquids New River Project LLC, Convent Gas Plant, has never had an accident involving butane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in place.

The emergency response program.  In the event of an emergency involving a flammable hydrocarbon mixture, it is our policy to notify the Sorrento Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.  We have discussed this policy with the fire department.  When necessary, additional emergency response support has been arranged with the St. Amant Fire Department.
